page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO MENDLESHAM
page.content: Mendlesham is very old. It is a village in the country with about 1200 people and it is in the county of Suffolk. The houses are made of bricks but the old houses are made of clay and mud with timber frames. We have a few big buildings. We have a church, a health centre with three doctors, a road haulage firm and a maltings that has recently closed down. It is now used for storing barley. We also have a primary school and a bus and coach station called Galloways and seven shops. When the children go to the middle school and high school they go on the bus or coach.
